DOC.HEADLINE: SHUTTLE ASTRONAUTS READY ENDEAVOUR FOR LANDING
DOC.TEXT: The space shuttle Endeavour ' s astronauts test-fired their steering jets and wiggled their flaps Sunday in preparation for their return home . Endeavour is scheduled to land just before 9 a.m. PDT Tuesday , ending an Earth observation mission that began April 9.Weather forecasts are favorable for a landing at the Kennedy Space Center . Commander Sidney Gutierrez and pilot Kevin Chilton activated hydraulic_systems that drive wing and tail flaps Sunday and then fired 44 steering jets on the shuttle ' s nose and tail . Mission Control said the checkout went well . The $ 366-million radar imaging system in Endeavour ' s cargo bay continued to scan Earth . NASA officials said the radar system has filled 124 reels of tape on board the shuttle with recorded data for later analysis on Earth . Some pictures are also transmitted to the ground . Scientists at the Johnson Space Center in Houston said they were delighted with the images they were getting . At a crew news_conference televised to reporters at Mission Control , the astronauts talked_about the spectacular views .
